Krisztián Hofstädter

swimming

A music release with sound design and composition for Jane Upton’s 'Swimming', a theatre play directed by Paul Bourne at Menagerie, Cambridge. The music is mainly electronic with elements of hip-hop and drum and bass.

time: Sep 2014

tags: music, music-release, theatre, electronic-music

Sound design and composition for Jane Upton’s Swimming, directed by Paul Bourne at Menagerie, Cambridge. The music is mainly electronic with elements of hip-hop and drum and bass.

tools: Logic

other credits: photo of Jack with arms open by Andrew Wilkinson, producer: Emily Murray, cast: Jack Bence, Jessica Madsen and Grace Watts.



the plot

‘Three teenagers trapped on the Isle of Wight, desperate to make their mark on the world. But is the pull of the past too strong? Under starry skies and seaside lights, Jack, Lucy and Milly are spending their summer working in a greasy seaside café. Behind the banter, bravado and occasional hangover, the three teens struggle with past heartache, disconnection and anxiety about a future they just can’t seem to start living.’
